p: However, it is evident that the cost elements can only provide a rough estimate of the total costs. We do, for example, not include political costs, which may be required by the concessionaires of the deposits in the Arctic region. Political costs often include e.g., direct costs related to the permission award or to the provision of safety and security measures required by most of the involved communities or states. These political costs may drastically change the economic viability of an Arctic hydrocarbon export scheme up to conditions, where political costs have to be considered as a “show stopper.”
